issue.title: feat: add initial support for source RPMs

labels.name: size/L
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 100-499 lines, ignoring generated files.

issue.body:
This PR adds support for generating source RPMs, fixing #3136.

Firstly, thank you for the excellent architecture in `goreleaser`! It was much easier to add this initial functionality than I expected.

This PR is not ready for merge yet, but is in reasonable shape, and ready for expert input:

* [x] It generates reasonable `.src.rpm` files that seem to have the correct contents.
* [x] the `.spec` file is configurable.
* [x] it seems to integrate well with goreleaser's architecture.

There are a certainly missing features:

* [ ] more thorough tests
* [ ] documentation

There are a number of unanswered questions:

* [ ] does this integrate with goreleaser correctly?
* [x] right now, this PR uses `google/rpmpack` directly instead of `goreleaser/nfpm`; should it use `goreleaser/nfpm` instead?
* [ ] what, exactly should the spec file template look like? I tried to follow [Fedora's guidelines on `.spec` files for Go projects](https://docs.fedoraproject.org/en-US/packaging-guidelines/Golang/) but still have many questions, especially as we're distributing source RPMs that build final binaries and don't want to create packages for every single dependency.

All feedback very welcome!


closes #3136

body:
hmm that's weird, will take a look

thanks

issue.title: test: update gomod

labels.name: size/XS
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 0-9 lines, ignoring generated files.

issue.body:
this should fix #5409 

I delete my local mod cache and ran the tests, and it seems to be working now.

seems like what most have in common is permissions? maybe docker fs doesn't work as expected for some reason?

There's another test that uses the outdated `nyhoor.io/websocket` library and so fails for the same reason as in the original post:

https://github.com/goreleaser/goreleaser/blob/be2b0cb8c2858e59adb8abbb888b00a4a8d100ec/internal/builders/golang/build_test.go#L938

I tried changing the tag `v2.5.1`, but this makes the test *extremely* slow as it clones the goreleaser repo and runs `go mod tidy`, which requires downloading all of goreleaser's dependencies.

How about creating a trivial repo with minimal dependencies for use in tests instead of using `github.com/goreleaser/goreleaser`?
Yeah that's probably a good idea. Will work on that

issue.title: test: improve speed, work on clean system

labels.name: size/L
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 100-499 lines, ignoring generated files.

issue.body:
this should help speed up the build times of goreleaser, as well as making them less-reliable on external dependencies.

tests now use https://github.com/goreleaser/test-mod instead of goreleaser codebase itself, which should also be faster to build/clone/etc.

refs #5409 as well

body:
should be fixed now on main!

thanks for reporting this!
